Course Description:
PREREQUISITE:ACG 3103 WITH C OR BETTER.
THIS COURSE INCLUDES ANALYSIS, DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRANSACTION PROCESSING CYCLES AND THE ROLES THEY PLAY IN THE INTERNAL CONTROL OF THE ORGANIZATION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. IDENTIFY TRANSACTION CYCLES AND INTERNAL CONTROL CONCEPTS
2. EXPLAIN THE ROLE OF TECHNOLOGY IN THE ORGANIZATION
3. EXPLAIN THE INFORMATION SYSTEM FUNCTION IN THE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE OF A BUSINESS ENTERPRISE
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
